question: 寄せる
sourceAnswer: to{} come-near/let-someone-approach | bring-near/bring-together/collect/gather | deliver-(opinion,-news,-etc.)/send-(e.g.-a-letter)/contribute/donate | let-someone-drop-by | add-(numbers) | have-feelings-for-(love,-goodwill,-trust,-etc.) | rely-upon-for-a-time/depend-on | use-as-a-pretext | put-aside | press/push/force | include/welcome-(in-a-group)/let-in
sourceMnemonic:
This word consists of kanji with hiragana attached. Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb.

This is a transitive verb. That means it takes a direct object. The kanji itself means <kanji>approach</kanji>, and the verb version is about making or letting something approach. That's why it means <vocabulary>to move something close to</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to pull something over</vocabulary>, and also <vocabulary>to contribute something</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: You want <vocabulary>to move something close to</vocabulary> you, but it's out of reach. The solution, of course, is to take out your trusty <reading>yo</reading>-yo (<ja>よ</ja>) and lasso that thing and pull it closer!
